part.bullet4: Models equipped with this latest technology still sound like a snowmobile should, but the level of sound output is lower than previously experienced with our ERA 2000 products

part.bullet6: Exit through stock belly pan location

part.bullet1: Maximize your sled's intake efficiency with an SLP High Flow™ intake kit
part.bullet2: Kits are designed specifically for each model to optimize the airflow to the engine
part.bullet3: This is achieved in two ways: first, we provide more available air and reduce the chance of getting plugged up or bogged down by adding more intake surface area using a model specific intake grate that includes a powder snow pre-filter; second, by eliminating flow restrictions in the stock system, we increase intake airflow volume for improvements in horsepower and throttle response

part.bullet1: Designed to remove hot air from the chassis and maintain higher horsepower by delivering additional cold air to the intake
part.bullet2: Left-side kits keep clutches running cooler and extend belt life, while right-side kits reduce underhood heat from the exhaust system for more consistent power production
part.bullet3: Vents use a powder snow pre-filter that blocks snow and ice but lets air pass through
part.bullet4: Kits include a side panel vent and two Flow-Rite™ intake kits
part.bullet5: Required fasteners and detailed installation instructions included

part.bullet1: SLP's system of venturi dividers placed in the bore of the carburetor on the engine side of the slide increases air velocity and improves fuel atomization
part.bullet2: Benefits include instant throttle response, improved low-end and mid-range horsepower, smoother low-end to mid-range transition, the ability to pull a higher gear coming out of corners, allowing the engine to pull through the rpm range quicker, helping eliminate low-end hesitation, eased engine tuning and added fuel economy
part.bullet3: Easy to install and tune

part.bullet2: Manufactured from the highest-quality chrome-silicone wire
part.bullet3: Shot-peened to make a durable spring that resists sagging and breakage

part.bullet1: Designed to harness the horsepower of new high-torque engines
part.bullet2: Heavy heel design and special weight profile provide greater shift force for improved acceleration and top speed
part.bullet3: Unique design provides responsive backshift performance
part.bullet4: Adjustable by adding tuning rivets (up to 6 grams per weight)
part.bullet5: No clutch modifications necessary
part.bullet6: To order, add 4 grams to the amount of weight you are currently using to choose the correct MTX, 9 Tower or 6 Tower weight (e.g.: if you are currently using a 10-64 Polaris weight, you should use a 68 gram MTX weight)
part.bullet7: Weights sold in sets of three, including six 1 gram, six 2 gram and six 3 gram rivets
part.bullet8: Replacement rivets sold in packs of six

part.bullet4: Lines are lightweight and flexible with a burst strength of 12,000 lb.
part.bullet5: Less hand effort required and up to 70% less expansion for better braking power to the caliper
part.bullet6: -67° to +464° operating range

part.bullet1: Provide the ultimate in loose-snow performance for maximum flotation and precise steering control
part.bullet2: Patented bottom design with a multilevel keel
part.bullet3: Only the lower keel contacts the snow in packed-snow conditions; shares design features with SLT skis to provide precise steering with reduced darting
part.bullet4: Upper keel comes into play in deep powder and loose snow; sidewall adds steering control
part.bullet5: Compaction Control Technology (CCT) uses powder control wings to direct snow under the ski, where it is compacted to add ski lift
part.bullet6: Deep-snow steering ability is increased along with low-speed mobility
part.bullet7: Add front-end lift, which reduces drag on front end components such as the belly pan, bulkhead, front suspension and steering components
part.bullet8: Recommended for mountain/powder riding and snocross-type conditions
part.bullet9: Sold each with black loop; order ski, mount saddle and carbides separately; optional colored loop handles sold on previous page

part.bullet1: Provide the ultimate in loose-snow performance for maximum flotation and precise steering control

part.bullet4: Upper keel comes into play in deep powder and loose snow; sidewall adds steering control
part.bullet5: Compaction Control Technology (CCT) uses powder control wings to direct snow under the ski, where it is compacted to add ski lift
part.bullet6: Deep-snow steering ability is increased along with low-speed mobility
part.bullet7: Add front-end lift, which reduces drag on front end components such as the belly pan, bulkhead, front suspension and steering components
part.bullet8: Recommended for mountain/powder riding and snocross-type conditions
part.bullet9: Sold each with black loop; order ski, mount saddle and carbides separately; optional colored loop handles sold on previous page
